item.title: Bandcamp / Site Redesign
item.content:encoded:
Hello! Long time no see... Two news:
1. Presqu'île Records is now on Bandcamp, with streams, downloads (FLAC / MP3) and CDs.
2. The website has been redesigned to be mobile-friendly (please contact us if you find any bugs).

item.title: First Donation
item.description: It’s been seven months since the release date of VA – Fukushima!, and today a first donation of $940* has been sent to the Japan Society’s Japan Earthquake Refief Fund. It is, of course, a modest contribution… but after all, mountains are climbed one step at a time. There are still some compilations available so [...]
item.content:encoded:
It’s been seven months since the release date of VA – Fukushima!, and today a first donation of $940* has been sent to the Japan Society’s Japan Earthquake Refief Fund. It is, of course, a modest contribution… but after all, mountains are climbed one step at a time.

There are still some compilations available so you can continue to support the cause, but meanwhile, I’d like to thank everyone who ordered VA – Fukushima!, and everyone involved in this project: Otomo Yoshihide, The Japan Society, John Tilbury, Magda Mayas, Choi Joonyong, Joe Foster, Hong Chulki, Jin Sangtae, Burkhard Beins, Mark Wastell, Jonathan McHugh, Annette Krebs, Chris Abrahams, Sabine Erklenz, Chris Heenan, Mike Majkowski, Andrea Neumann, Koen Nutters, Morten Olsen, Dave Smith, Jim Denley, Kim Myhr, Ingar Zach, Michael Pisaro, Greg Stuart, Greg Kelley, AVVA (Billy Roisz and Toshimaru Nakamura), Billy Gomberg, Richard Kamerman, Christoph Amann (Amann Studios Vienna), Tony Buck, Jon Abbey (ErstDist), Yoshiyuki Suzuki (IMJ), Jérôme Noetinger and the Metamkine team, Phil Zampino (Squidco), Lim and The Book Society, Will Long (Floor Sugar), Bimbo Tower, Leanne Shapton, Amy Casey, and thanks a lot to Alastair Wilson (Admirable Restraint), Derek Walmsley (Adventures In Sound And Music) and Luka Zagoricnik (Godbeni Imperializem) for their support.


* Update 2013-02-26: $1078

item.title: Review at TMT
item.description: VA – Fukushima! reviewed by Matthew Horne at Tiny Mix Tapes.
item.content:encoded: VA – Fukushima! reviewed by Matthew Horne at Tiny Mix Tapes.

item.title: The Wire, PT reviews
item.description: VA – Fukushima! reviewed this month in Paris Transatlantic and in The Wire #342 (August 2012 edition).
item.content:encoded: VA – Fukushima! reviewed this month in Paris Transatlantic and in The Wire #342 (August 2012 edition).

item.title: On Resonance FM
item.description: An excerpt of VA – Fukushima! was recently broadcasted by Resonance FM (Derek Walmsley’s Adventures In Sound And Music). A stream is available here. Note also that the recent Michael Pisaro / Toshiya Tsunoda on Erstwhile (Crosshatches) is also in the playlist.
item.content:encoded:
An excerpt of VA – Fukushima! was recently broadcasted by Resonance FM (Derek Walmsley’s Adventures In Sound And Music). A stream is available here.
Note also that the recent Michael Pisaro / Toshiya Tsunoda on Erstwhile (Crosshatches) is also in the playlist.

item.title: Flags Across Borders (and more)
item.description: Some recent news: Flags Across Borders : A call for the Festival FUKUSHIMA! (Synchronized Worldwide Events), by Otomo Yoshihide. VA – Fukushima! is now available at Floor Sugar (Tokyo, JPN). Richard Pinnell reviewed the compilation at The Watchful Ear.
item.content:encoded:
Some recent news:

  • Flags Across Borders : A call for the Festival FUKUSHIMA! (Synchronized Worldwide Events), by Otomo Yoshihide.
  • VA – Fukushima! is now available at Floor Sugar (Tokyo, JPN).
  • Richard Pinnell reviewed the compilation at The Watchful Ear.

item.title: Radio & review
item.description: Two tracks of VA – Fukushima! are in the playlist of Luka Zagoričnik’s radio show, Godbeni Imperializem. A stream is available here. Also, John Eyles published a review of the compilation in All About Jazz.
item.content:encoded:
Two tracks of VA – Fukushima! are in the playlist of Luka Zagoričnik’s radio show, Godbeni Imperializem. A stream is available here.

Also, John Eyles published a review of the compilation in All About Jazz .

item.title: Admirable Restraint
item.description: Two tracks of VA – Fukushima! are in the playlist of Alastair Wilson’s radio show, Admirable Restraint #44. Note that the show is available for the forthcoming 14 days on archive.org.
item.content:encoded:
Two tracks of VA – Fukushima! are in the playlist of Alastair Wilson’s radio show, Admirable Restraint #44.

Note that the show is available for the forthcoming 14 days on archive.org.

item.title: “VA – Fukushima!” is out today!
item.description: VA – Fukushima! is out today and available at our shop. The compilation will soon be available in different shops / distributors: Bimbo Tower (Paris, France) Erstwhile / ErstDist (Jersey City, NJ, USA) Floor Sugar (Tokyo, Japan) Improvised Music from Japan (Tokyo, Japan) Metamkine (Rives, France) Squidco (Wilmington, NC, USA) The Book Society (Seoul, South [...]
item.content:encoded:
VA – Fukushima! is out today and available at our shop.

The compilation will soon be available from our distributors.

item.title: “Fukushima!” pre-orders
item.description: The release date of VA – Fukushima! has been to April 23, 2012. Pre-orders are now opened in our shop, and the double compilation will soon be available from your favorite distributors. As mentioned earlier, 100% of the the sales of this release will benefit Japan Society’s Japan Earthquake Refief Fund. Please spread the word [...]
item.content:encoded:
The release date of VA – Fukushima! has been to April 23, 2012.


Pre-orders are now opened in our shop, and the double compilation will soon be available from your favorite distributors.

As mentioned earlier, 100% of the the sales of this release will benefit Japan Society’s Japan Earthquake Refief Fund.


Please spread the word around you!

item.title: “Fukushima!” preview
item.description: Currently at the pressing plant, the VA – Fukushima! compilation is coming very soon. Some excerpts of the tracks are available here, or on SoundCloud. Profiles of the musicians are also available on this page.
item.content:encoded:
Currently at the pressing plant, the VA – Fukushima! compilation is coming very soon.
Some excerpts of the tracks are available here, or on SoundCloud.
Profiles of the musicians are also available on this page.
